Yes what I think we need here is a general proposal for how events should work at a system level. Where do they fit in, what can they do, etc.
Filters are removed in S3, what was going to replace them?
I think the idea was to scrap filters and provide a better set of delegates for manipulating events, but it never happened.
3) Goals - 15 mins
2) Scope - 10 mins

Just that there's no reason for event types to be limited to entry-saving

No worries :)
Don't think so, because users should be able to create other kinds of events
yeah
In Symphony 2, events were quite limited because there was only one type of event—the entry-saving event
but I like them, however badly they are named
Good morning all. I think that's all I've got for background.
Hi guys. Will be joining you on my lunch brake, but I don't know how much I'll have to say.
Every other type in the system—field types, ds types, etc—will be provided by an extension. It likely makes sense for event types as well
I've got a massive dump of information that doesn't really fit into that mould
should I post anyway?
as long as its just background to the convo

Current Limitations/Bad things

- Event messages cannot be localised. Frontend logic must compare to a value, ie. message = 'Field can not be blank' and then localise via XSLT
- Fields can only return a simple error message (can't add attributes or a structure)
- When an event is saved, although a Field may return a specific error code, the Entry only cares if it is successful. If it is not successful the Event just gets the Entry failed code, instead of the Field failure code. This makes events cumbersome in that they can only be 'success' or 'fail'
- Message of the event is not customisable
- Example form markup is not utilised well/at all by extensions
- Debugging events is notoriously annoying (how many forum posts have we had about AJAX events recently?)
- Send Mail filter is horrible
The biggest for me is the first 3

What I think works well

- I think the delegates, while maybe missing a couple of values are a solid start and helpful for extensions. Delegates may need execution order, but this is only a problem because of Symphony's growth/success (with multiple extensions subscribing to the same delegate) and it's not limited to events 
- Custom events are powerful, users can do alot, but it's been poorly documented until recently, unsure what we can do to make it better, worth throwing up

What's changed in S3 at the moment

- Default/Override values (don't know if these are actually working or not though)
- Expect Multiple doesn't work (IIRC?)
- Send Mail filter has been removed, extensions can deal with it
- Filters have been removed (IIRC)
- Events are extensions, creating a new event is writing a new Event object. It works, but it's far from nice when creating a new UI Editor (same goes for Datasources). But it does allow you to create different types of Events

Up for discussion

- Execution of an event might be useful if brought to the Event Editor (load/trigger functions)
- I personally like Event Filters and think they offer an elegant solution to allow extensions to beef up events. I can't think of the alternative for S3, and at the moment all extensions that were moved to S3 that were filters have been completely rewritten to work differently
we hit those issues in Members
